treatment.description: Spiroplasma phoeniceum sp. nov. Spiroplasma phoeniceum (phoe.ni’ ce.um. L. neut. adj. Phoeniceus of Phoenice, an ancient country that was located on today’s Syrian coast, referring to the geographical origin of the isolates). Chemoorganotroph. Acid produced from glucose. Hydrolyzes arginine. Does not hydrolyze urea. Phosphatase positive. Haemadsorbs guinea pig erythrocytes. Film-and-spot positive. Cholesterol required for growth. Facultative anaerobe. Temperature range, 20 to 37°C; temperature optimum, 28 to 32°C. Isolated from periwinkles that were naturally infected in various locations along the Syrian coastal area. The G+C content of the DNA is 26 +/- 1 mol%. Type strain: strain P40 (= ATCC 43115).
